授業目的: This class provides opportunities for students to “simulate” their future job application processes for and have hands on experience working at the United Nations and other relevant organizations as interns and contributing to the performance of assigned offices and programmes.
到達目標: Students successfully applied and accepted as interns at a UN, international NGOs and other relevant organizations, performed assigned tasks and having their competencies assessed for future job applications at UN and other public sector organizations.
関連科目: Career Seminar for International Organizations, Management of International Organizations, Seminar in Global Communication, Seminar in Global Diversity
授業の概要・背景: Starting from searching for internship opportunities and preparing application documents, performing assigned tasks, and having assessed their performance, this class will also provide students with opportunities to test and expand their knowledge and competencies. Students are expected to reflect their internship opportunities to sharpen their career and competency development plans after the internship.
授業方法: 1) Face to face. Orientation, consultation, guidance and assessment before, during and after the internship

トピック.授業計画1:
Pre-departure programme:
1) Initial orientation and expression of their interest areas and organizations (at the beginning of first year)
2) Assignment of students to relevant professors, and consultation with advising professors.
3) Search for internship opportunities and selection of a number of posts.
4) Preparation of internship documents, including letter of intent and curriculum vitae
5) Contacting organizations and sending applications (3-6 months before internship)
6) Screening and interviews, acceptance of interns by selected organization/s
7) Preparation for departure and departure

During internship:
1) Arrival, initial guidance, confirmation of terms of reference, and settlement. (first reporting)
2) Periodical and mid-term consultation with professors (email or video conference based)
3) Completion of internship assignment and assessment of internship by supervising officer. (As per Evaluation sheet)

After internship:
1) Final reporting on internship
2) Updating students’ career and competency development plans based on internship experience.
トピック.授業外学習2: This internship is a commitment and an opportunity, thus should be taken seriously throughout the internship processes. Students are expected to enhance their UN competencies including their core values and core competencies, as well as their understanding of the organization that they will apply for and intern with.
